name: df-drngo
body: |- wceq(cdrng, copab(s0, s1, wa(wcel(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), crngo), wcel(cres(cv(s1), cxp(cdif(crn(cv(s0)), csn(cfv(cgi, cv(s0)))), cdif(crn(cv(s0)), csn(cfv(cgi, cv(s0)))))), cgr))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ DivRingOps = { < s0, s1 > |(< s0, s1 > ∈ RingOps ∧(s1 |`((ran(s0)\ {(GId ` s0)})×(ran(s0)\ {(GId ` s0)})))∈ GrpOp)}
comment: Define the class of all division rings (sometimes called skew fields). A division ring is a unital ring where every element except the additive identity has a multiplicative inverse. (Contributed by NM, 4-Apr-2009.) (New usage is discouraged.)
